title: Junior Mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
Är du intresserad av en spännande möjlighet inom mjukvaruutveckling? På Snáithe har vi en ledig tjänst som Junior mjukvaruutvecklare där du får chansen att arbeta med moderna teknologier och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team.
  
  

**Ansvarsområden:**  

Designa och utveckla effektiva lösningar med .NET Framework för Docker-behållare och .NET Microservices.
  
Implementera .NET-applikationer med Docker, Mesosphere och Kubernetes för smidig distribution.
  
Utveckla frontend-komponenter med React JS för att säkerställa en sömlös användarupplevelse.
  
Samarbeta med teamet för att förstå kundprojekt och planera tekniska lösningar.
  
  

**Krav:**  

Erfarenhet inom .NET-backend-utveckling och mikrotjänster.
  
Goda samarbets- och kommunikationsfärdigheter är viktiga för effektivt arbete både lokalt och internationellt.
  
Kunskaper i React JS för frontend-utveckling.
  
Kunskaper i både Urdu och Hindi för att underlätta kommunikationen inom teamet och med vissa internationella kunder.
  
  

Om du är en passionerad mjukvaruutvecklare med intresse för både backend- och frontend-teknologier samt mikrotjänster, uppmanar vi dig att ansöka. Bli en del av vårt team på Snáithe och hjälp till att skapa innovativa applikationer och lösningar.
  
För att ansöka, kontakta oss via e-post på developer@snaithe.com. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
Besök vår webbplats på https://codehide.com/.
  
  

**English:**  

Are you interested in an exciting opportunity in Software Development? At Snáithe, we have a Junior Software Developer position available where you'll have the chance to work with cutting-edge technologies and be part of a dynamic team.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Design and develop efficient solutions using .NET Framework for Docker containers and .NET Microservices.
  
Implement .NET applications with Docker, Mesosphere, and Kubernetes for seamless distribution.
  
Develop frontend components using React JS to ensure a seamless user experience.
  
Collaborate with the team to understand client projects and plan technical solutions.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Experience in .NET backend development and microservices.
  
Strong collaboration and communication skills are essential for effective work both locally and internationally.
  
Proficiency in React JS for frontend development.
  
Knowledge of both Urdu and Hindi to facilitate communication within the team and with certain international clients.
  
  

If you're a passionate software developer with an interest in both backend and frontend technologies and microservices, we encourage you to apply. Join our team at Snáithe and help create innovative applications and solutions.
  
To apply, contact us via email at developer@snaithe.com. We look forward to receiving your application!
  
Visit our website at https://codehide.com/.

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
##### **More independence, freedom, and better pay**


Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.


It's not rocket science.


Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.


The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.


Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.

##### **Why Coody**


At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?

**Maximized Compensation** - Typically a +40% salary increase.

**Freedom & Flexibility** - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.

**Employment Security** - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.

**Shaping the Future** - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.

##### **This is Coody**


We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.


Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.


Explore our **Employee Handbook** and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.

##### **What you’ll be doing**


As a Senior Software Engineer at Coody, you’ll be working on challenging and fun assignments for companies that you can be proud to have worked with. You’ll be a key player in designing and building scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, while also contributing to areas like working methods, product strategy, and maintaining a great team spirit.


You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to jump headfirst into new environments. We’re all about embracing new challenges as opportunities to grow, so if you thrive in a dynamic setting, this is the place for you. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year.

##### **Who you are**


We’re looking for Software Engineers with **5+ years of experience** and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you’ve got the following, you’re probably a great fit:

* Experience building scalable software in cloud environments
* Expertise in at least one modern programming language like **TypeScript, JavaScript, Java, .Net, Golang, Kotlin, Rust, Ruby, Erlang / Elixir, Python (you get the idea)**, and related frameworks
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or something related
* **Based in Sweden** - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)

##### 
**How to apply**


Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Fullstackutvecklare till Dentme
description:
**Om Dentme – tandvård som den borde vara**
-------------------------------------------


Dentme är den första privata aktören i Sverige som erbjuder tandvård på abonnemang – helt utan bindningstider. Vi bygger framtidens tandvård, där patientens hälsa och upplevelse alltid står i centrum. Vår enkla prismodell gör det möjligt för tandläkare att fokusera på högsta vårdkvalitet utan ekonomiska incitament som styr arbetet. Resultatet är nöjdare patienter och en hållbar affärsmodell för alla inblandade.


Med 150 miljoner kronor i färsk riskkapitalfinansiering, uppmärksammat av Dagens Industri, är vi väl rustade att växa snabbt och ta tandvården in i en ny era.

**Om rollen**
-------------


Vi söker nu **fullstackutvecklare** som vill vara med och skapa framtidens tandvårdsplattform. Hos oss kombineras teknikintresse med samhällsengagemang – i ett team där gemenskap, samarbete och inkludering är en självklar del av vardagen.


Det här är en roll där du kommer att arbeta i hela stacken – från frontend och backend till integrationer, infrastruktur och drift. Du blir en del av ett litet vasst team som bygger nytt med moderna verktyg och utan en tung ryggsäck av historik att släpa på.


Vi tror att du kommer in med dina styrkor och intressen, men också är nyfiken och bekväm med att lära dig nytt. Tillsammans med dina kollegor kommer du bidra till att skapa en stabil, skalbar och användarvänlig produkt som både patienter och tandvårdspersonal älskar.


Teamet består initialt två utvecklare, en tech lead, produktägare och UX-resurser.

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla nya funktioner och tjänster i hela stacken.
* Bygga integrationer mot externa system som journalsystem, betalningslösningar och BankID.
* Delta i arkitekturdiskussioner och bidra till tekniska beslut.
* Arbeta med CI/CD, drift och säkerhet.
* Skriva ren, testbar kod och göra code reviews.

**Vår tekniska miljö**
----------------------


Vi bygger en modern, skalbar plattform för framtidens tandvård. Några nyckelkomponenter i vår tech-stack och miljö:

* **Backend:** Python/Django
* **Frontend:** TypeScript/React/Next.js
* **Databas:** PostgreSQL
* **CI/CD:** GitHub Actions
* **Drift:** Containeriserat med Docker, hosting via privat moln (planerad flytt till AWS)
* **Säkerhet:** Cloudflare WAF & DDoS-skydd
* **Integrationer:** Muntra (journalsystem), Adyen (betalningar), BankID (autentisering)
* **Analys & BI:** Metabase

**Vad vi erbjuder**
-------------------

* **Möjlighet att bygga något nytt** – du arbetar med modern teknik och påverkar arkitekturen i ett tidigt skede
* **Stort utrymme att påverka** – dina idéer får snabbt genomslag i produkten
* **Meningsfullt uppdrag** - Dentme vill förändra en hel bransch till det bättre. Genom att kombinera teknik och tandvård förbättrar vi upplevelsen för både patienter och tandläkare. Ditt arbete kommer bidra till att folk får bättre och mer tillgänglig tandvård, utan krångliga kostnader.
* **Stabilitet och resurser:** Även om vi är i startup-fasen har vi stabil ekonomi med riskkapitalfinansiering och ett högt kundinflöde. Du får det bästa av två världar – en startups snabbfothet och resurserna att faktiskt förverkliga ambitiösa planer.
* **Hybridarbete & flex:** Vi sitter i fräscha lokaler i Stockholm (Sveavägen, mitt i city) och vill gärna ha dig på kontoret ~3 dagar i veckan för att bygga teamkänsla och samarbeta effektivt. Övriga dagar kan du arbeta på distans om du vill. Vi är flexibla med upplägg – det viktiga är att vi hittar ett arbetssätt som funkar för teamet i stort.
* **Agilt och pragmatiskt:** Vi kör idag enligt Scrum-inspirerade arbetsmetoder, men vi sätter **bra arbetsprocesser framför att strikt följa ett visst ramverk**. Filosofin är att anpassa hur vi jobbar kontinuerligt efter vad som passar vårt team bäst.

**Vem är du?**
--------------


För att trivas och lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du:

* Har djupare kompetens inom något område, men kan och vill jobba i hela stacken – även med infrastruktur och drift.
* Tycker det låter spännande att arbeta med vår teknikstack
* Gillar att jobba i team, dela kunskap och lösa problem tillsammans.
* Är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en miljö där inte allt är färdigt – du ser det som en chans att skapa.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska.

**Ansökan**
-----------


Låter det spännande? Ansök idag! Skicka ditt CV eller LinkedIn och några rader om varför du är intresserad, så pratar vi mer.


Har du frågor om rollen eller Dentme? Kontakta vår rekryteringsansvarige på robert@dentme.com.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

*Bli en del av Dentme och var med att rita om kartan för en hel bransch. Framtidens tandvård väntar – är du den utvecklare som hjälper oss bygga den?*

title: Embedded-utvecklare
description:
Är du en tekniskt driven embeddedutvecklare som vill arbeta med robusta lösningar inom försvars- och telekombranschen? Letar du efter en roll där **C eller C++** är dina främsta verktyg, och där du får vara nära tekniken? Då är Knowit Connectivity rätt plats för dig.


Vi är ett växande specialistteam som brinner för systemnära utveckling, och trots att konsult- och R&D-marknaden varit utmanande en tid, ser vi **en tydlig uppgång just nu**. Med flera projekt i startgroparna under hösten söker vi nu fler skarpa kollegor.

### **Din roll hos oss**


I rollen som embeddedutvecklare kommer du att arbeta i teknikintensiva projekt där krav på prestanda, säkerhet och tillförlitlighet är höga. Projekten varierar i längd och form – vissa är inhouse hos oss, andra ute hos kund, och många i hybridformat. Det gemensamma? Du jobbar aldrig ensam – vi är ett lag även när vi är utspridda.


Du kommer arbeta med:

* Programmering i **C eller C++** – på hårdvarunära nivå eller i komplexa realtidssystem
* Lågnivåutveckling, t.ex. drivrutiner, protokollstackar eller bootloaderlogik
* Inbyggda system med **RTOS, embedded Linux eller bare-metal**
* Kommunikation via t.ex. UART, CAN, SPI, Ethernet, I2C
* Automatisering och scripting i Python
* Testning på enhets-, integrations- och/eller systemnivå

### **Vi söker dig som:**

* Har **stark kompetens i C eller C++** för inbyggda system
* Förstår realtidskrav och systemnära utveckling
* Har erfarenhet av hårdvarunära arbete eller intresse att fördjupa dig inom det
* Är nyfiken, driven och gillar att samarbeta i teknikfokuserade miljöer
* Har erfarenhet från – eller intresse för – **försvar, telekom eller fordon**


Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:

* Säkerhetskritiska miljöer (t.ex. ISO 21434, A-SPICE, DO-178C)
* Kravhantering, spårbar utveckling eller arbete i reglerade branscher
* Agila metoder som Scrum och Kanban
* Testning med HIL, VIL eller MIL
* End-to-end ansvar i utvecklingscykeln

### **Varför Knowit Connectivity?**


Vi är ett företag med stark teknisk förankring, lång erfarenhet i branschen och fokus på hållbar utveckling – både vad gäller människor och teknik. Även om marknaden varit skakig det senaste året, märker vi nu av **ökad efterfrågan inom både försvar och telekom**.


Flera nya projekt är på väg in, och vi bygger långsiktigt. Vi tror på samarbete, kunskapsdelning och på att ge våra medarbetare möjligheten att växa – även i tuffare tider.

### **Låter det intressant?**


Skicka in din ansökan eller hör av dig direkt så berättar vi mer – vi hanterar ansökningar löpande.

**Kontaktperson:**  

David Blaag Nilsson  

david.blaag-nilsson@knowit.se

title: C++ Utvecklare
description:
Vi på Knowit har funnits i Örebro under flera år med vårt affärsområde Solutions, nu växer vi ytterligare med affärsområdet Connectivity. Hos Knowit Connectivity kombinerar vi teknisk spetskompetens med ett genuint engagemang för våra medarbetare. Vi söker nu en erfaren C++-utvecklare som vill vara en del av vårt växande team. Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med avancerad teknik, vara med och forma vår verksamhet och bidra till vår framgångsrika expansion i regionen.


**Om rollen**


Som C++-utvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta med tekniskt utmanande projekt inom en rad olika branscher, från inbyggda system till realtidssystem. Du blir en del av ett starkt team av specialister där innovation, samarbete och problemlösning står i centrum. Vi söker dig som har ett stort intresse för utveckling och vill bidra till att stärka Knowits position som en ledande aktör inom systemutveckling.


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling i C/C++.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom datateknik, IT, systemvetenskap, maskinteknik eller liknande.
* Ett intresse för tekniskt avancerade projekt och problemlösning.
* God kommunikationsförmåga och vana att samarbeta i team.

**Meriterande erfarenheter:**


* **Linux**: Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Linux-baserade utvecklingsmiljöer.
* **Qt**: Erfarenhet av utveckling med Qt-ramverket.
* **Inbyggda system**: Erfarenhet av utveckling för inbyggda system.
* **Realtidssystem**: Kunskap om realtidsprogrammering och dess specifika krav.

**Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som är självgående, ansvarstagande och har en stark analytisk förmåga. Du är lösningsorienterad och kan snabbt anpassa dig efter kundernas behov. Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är ett stort plus då du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder och deras specifika utmaningar. Som en del av vårt team bidrar du med din expertis samtidigt som du fortsätter att utvecklas i din yrkesroll.


**Varför** Knowit Örebro?


Knowit Connectivity i Örebro är nystartat, och du får möjligheten att vara med från början i ett dynamiskt och växande team. Vi erbjuder en kreativ arbetsmiljö där du får utrymme att påverka och forma framtiden för både dig själv och vårt bolag. Samtidigt som vi har en lokal närvaro i Örebro, har du kraften av en stor organisation i ryggen med över 4000 specialister i Sverige och Norden.


Hos oss får du:


* Arbeta med spännande projekt och teknik.
* Vara en del av ett jämställt team där innovation och samarbete står i fokus.
* Professionell utveckling genom kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och nya utmaningar.
* Flexibla arbetstider och en god balans mellan arbete och privatliv.

**Låt oss bygga framtiden tillsammans!**


Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill vara med på vår tillväxtresa i Örebro, tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior Embedded Developer
description:
**Vill du vara en del av ett riktigt team, där din utvecklingsplan är tydlig och anpassad efter dina mål?**


Då har du hittat rätt! På Knowit Connectivity i Linköping bygger vi starka team och skapar innovativa lösningar för våra spännande kunder. Vi är stolta över att vara konsulter och drivs av att leverera värde i våra projekt, samtidigt som vi investerar i dig och din utveckling.

**Varför Knowit Connectivity?**


Hos oss får du mer än en arbetsplats – du blir en del av en gemenskap. Vi har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga starka team där du får växa tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor.

* **Personlig utveckling** – Vi erbjuder en skräddarsydd utvecklingsplan baserad på dina ambitioner och intressen.
* **Trygghet och stabilitet** – Som en del av Knowit, ett etablerat bolag, får du en trygg anställning med generösa förmåner inom pension, försäkring, hälsa och friskvård.
* **Jämställdhet och hållbarhet** – Vi arbetar aktivt för en inkluderande arbetsmiljö och är stolta över vårt mål att vara klimatneutrala.

**Vad vi gör och vad du får jobba med**


På Knowit Connectivity utvecklar vi tekniska lösningar som förändrar världen. Vårt arbete sträcker sig från avancerade 5G-lösningar och uppkopplade fordon till banbrytande utveckling inom defence, automotive och telecom.


Som embeddedutvecklare hos oss arbetar du med C/C++ i Linux-miljöer och RTOS, ofta nära hårdvaran men även högre upp i stacken. Du blir en del av ett stöttande och tekniskt skickligt team där du kan fördjupa dig inom det du brinner för, samtidigt som du bidrar till att skapa framtidens innovativa lösningar.

**Vem vi letar efter**


Vi söker dig som har:

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av embeddedutveckling
* Stark teknisk grund inom C och C++
* Erfarenhet av Linux-miljöer och RTOS
* Vana av att arbeta nära hårdvara och i mjukvarustacken
* Meriterande erfarenhet från defence, automotive eller telecom
* Teknisk utbildning och starkt intresse för systemutveckling
* Måste kunna genomgå en säkerhetsprövning
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

**Har vi övertygat dig?**


Skicka in din ansökan idag, vi rekryterar löpande! Har du frågor? Tveka inte att höra av dig!

title: AI Software Developer
description:
### **Din roll**


Som AI Software Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av avancerade AI-applikationer. Du får möjlighet att:

* Arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom AI och maskininlärning.
* Ta fram och implementera lösningar som är skalbara och anpassade för våra kunders behov.
* Ge teknisk vägledning och fatta strategiska beslut kring arkitektur och lösningsdesign.
* Stödja och inspirera teamet till teknisk excellens.


Vi erbjuder en miljö där innovation och samarbete är i fokus, och du får möjlighet att vara del av ett passionerat team som arbetar med projekt i framkant av AI-teknologin.

### **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att:

* Arbeta som Tech Lead eller i en liknande ledande roll inom AI-utveckling.
* Ge teknisk vägledning och fatta strategiska beslut kring arkitektur och lösningsdesign.
* Stödja teammedlemmar och inspirera till teknisk excellens.
* Bygga AI-lösningar som är skalbara, hållbara och anpassade för kundernas behov.


Du har arbetat inom några av följande områden:

* **Programmering:** Python (gärna med bibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch eller Scikit-learn).
* **AI-teknik:** Erfarenhet av LLM (Large Language Models), Transformer-arkitekturer och generativa AI-verktyg.
* **MLOps:** Erfarenhet av verktyg för AI-pipelines som Kubeflow, MLflow eller liknande.
* **Containerteknik:** Docker och Kubernetes.
* **API-utveckling:** REST och/eller GraphQL.
* **Molnplattformar:** AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
* **CI/CD:** Bygga och optimera kontinuerliga integrations- och leveransprocesser.

### **Meriterande erfarenheter**


Det är extra meriterande om du har:

* Kunskap om databaser som SQL eller NoSQL.
* Erfarenhet av datavisualiseringsverktyg som Tableau eller Power BI.
* Stark förståelse för matematik, statistik och optimering.
* Intresse för etiska och ansvarfulla AI-principer, inklusive fairness och explainability.

### **Varför Knowit?**


På Knowit Connectivity får du en unik möjlighet att kombinera teknik och innovation med personlig utveckling. Vi är ett team av engagerade och kunniga medarbetare som brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder och samhället. Hos oss får du arbeta i en miljö där din kompetens tas till vara och där du får chansen att växa och utvecklas.


Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss? Besök vår hemsida eller kontakta vår rekryterare Rasmus Lundin rasmus.lundin@knowit.se eller vår konsultchef Mikael Holm mikael.holm@knowit.se

### **Låter detta som en roll för dig?**


Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Paf stands out from other gaming companies in the market! Not just because of what we do, but** ***why*** **we do it.** We were founded by the Red Cross, Save the Children, Public Health on Åland, and the foundation Dagens Barn, and our mission from day one has been to generate funds for the benefit of society.


We’re proud to be an award-winning industry leader in responsible gaming, raising the bar and setting new standards that put players first. All our profit goes to charity, and we strive for a long-term sustainable business that care about our employees, customers, and society at large.


Now, we’re looking for a skilled **Senior Frontend Developer** to strengthen our growing frontend team.

### **THE TEAM & ROLE**


You’ll join a talented and skilled team, known for their collaborative mindset and passion for high-quality code. The team values clean architecture, thoughtful problem-solving, and open knowledge sharing. Here you'll see that everyone contributes, and everyone’s voice matters.


The team is responsible for the whole stack from Cloudflare, through React applications and API servers (Backend For Frontend), down to the infrastructure in AWS.


In this role, you’ll work across the entire development lifecycle; from idea and planning to implementation, deployment, and continuous improvement.

### **YOUR PROFILE**


You are curious, driven, and love building great user experiences. You take initiative but are also a strong team player who communicates clearly and asks for help when needed.

**We believe you have:**

* 5+ years of experience working with React
* Professional experience with TypeScript

 **Bonus if you also bring:**

* API design skills with GraphQL and REST
* Experience with headless CMS (like Sanity)
* Familiarity with Redis or similar technologies
* Hands-on cloud experience, especially with AWS

  

### **WE OFFER**

* A company with steady, purposeful growth since 1966
* A workplace that values creativity, autonomy, and wellbeing
* Generous remote work options and support for your home setup
* Occupational healthcare and insurance
* A culture that prioritizes long-term success over short-term stress; overtime is something rare at Paf.

### 

### **WORK SETUP**

**In Sweden**: Choose your working location; 100% remote, hybrid, or office based. Offices in Stockholm and Norrköping.

**In Mariehamn (Åland Islands)**: Hybrid/remote, with 3 days per week in our beautiful, modern HQ. Enjoy weekly breakfasts, seminars, massage, an office gym, and more.

### **PRACTICAL INFO**

**Start**: As soon as possible, depending on notice perio  

**Type**: Full-time, permanent with a 6-month probation period  

**Location**: Sweden or Mariehamn  

**Application**: Via our web form only (GDPR compliance)  

**Recruitment Process**: Includes a programming assignment, followed by tech interviews and a meeting with the hiring manager

  

We review applications continuously and close the process as soon as we’ve found the right person.

title: Fullstack utvecklare till Umefast
description:
*Sedan starten 1991 har Umefast förenklat och förbättrat många av sina kunders vardag med sin kompletta plattform för fastighetsförvaltning,* ***Pondus Pro****. Idag samarbetar de med såväl större privata företag som ledande universitet och kommuner. Nu söker de en* ***fullstackutvecklare*** *som vill vara med och vidareutveckla och modernisera plattformen för att skapa en ännu bättre upplevelse. Är det du?*

### **Vad du kommer att göra**


Som fullstackutvecklare hos Umefast arbetar du med hela kedjan – från backendlogik och databas till frontend och användargränssnitt. Du blir en del av utvecklingsteamet och kommer att:

* Utveckla och underhålla funktionalitet i Pondus Pro med fokus på **.NET/C#** och **SQL Server** i backend.
* Arbeta med integrationer, API:er och molnbaserade lösningar.
* Delta aktivt i sprintplanering, dagliga stand-ups och retrospektiv.
* Samarbeta tätt med både kollegor och kunder för att förstå behov och omsätta dem i smarta tekniska lösningar.

### **Vem vi tror att du är**


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som utvecklare inom **.NET/C#**.
* Goda kunskaper inom **SQL Server** och erfarenhet av att bygga och optimera databaser.
* Erfarenhet av moderna frontendramverk som **React** och **TypeScript**.
* Vana att arbeta med hela utvecklingskedjan, från idé till färdig lösning.
* Djup förståelse för systemdesign, designmönster och arkitektur.


Meriterande:

* Erfarenhet av att bygga system som hanterar stora datamängder och komplexa affärsflöden.
* Kunskap om Azure eller andra molnplattformar.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och automatiserade tester.

### **Om Umefast**


Umefast är ett svenskt företag som sedan 1991 har specialiserat sig på att leverera flexibla och kraftfulla systemlösningar för fastighetsförvaltning. Deras molnbaserade plattform, **Pondus Pro**, erbjuder omfattande funktioner för automation inom både teknisk och ekonomisk förvaltning, exempelvis ärendehantering, planerat underhåll och kontraktshantering.  

Företaget är **ISO 9001** och **ISO 14001**-certifierat, vilket understryker deras engagemang för kvalitet och hållbarhet. Med kunder inom statliga, kommunala och privata förvaltningsbolag över hela Norden, fortsätter Umefast att vara en ledande aktör inom digital fastighetsförvaltning.

### **Varför jobba hos Umefast?**


Hos Umefast står medarbetaren och kunden i centrum. Teamkänslan är navet i bolaget, där samarbete och innovation driver utvecklingen framåt. Här blir du en del av en familjär kultur där idéer välkomnas, och där du får möjlighet att växa både professionellt och personligt.  

Med spännande utmaningar inom digital fastighetsförvaltning och en miljö där vi stöttar och utmanar varandra, är Umefast en arbetsplats där du verkligen kan göra skillnad.


Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens smarta lösningar? Då är Umefast rätt plats för dig!

### **Ansökan**


I denna rekrytering samarbetar Umefast med **Talent(h)ify**.  

Frågor avseende tjänsten eller processen hänvisas till ansvarig rekryteringskonsult **Hanna Grahn**:  

hanna@talentify.se  

076-414 83 30

title: Fullstack Data & AI Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**


We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.


Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.

 **THE ROLE**


Join our Data Team as a Full Stack Applications/AI Developer, where you'll be at the forefront of transforming business processes through innovative Data & AI solutions. In this role, you'll develop comprehensive data heavy and AI applications that enhance operational efficiency across our organization. You'll work together with our Data Engineers & Analysts to create seamless, integrated systems that drive productivity and innovation. Experience in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is a plus but not required.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Data/AI Application Development:**
* + Design, develop, test, and deploy full stack data heavy and AI applications that streamline business processes.
	+ Integrate AI models with both front-end and back-end systems to ensure robust and user-friendly applications.
* **Collaboration & Integration:**
* + Work closely with the Data & Insights Team to translate business process into effective data and AI-driven solutions.
	+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of applications with existing systems.
* **Innovation & Continuous Improvement:**
* + Research and implement cutting-edge AI technologies and frameworks to drive continuous improvement.
	+ Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in AI and full stack development.
* **Optional Chatbot Development:**


Utilize experience (if applicable) in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots to enhance customer interaction channels.

 **WHAT WE WANT FROM YOU**

  

For us, it is equally important to find the right fit on an interpersonal level between us and a new colleague as it is to find someone with the right experience and competence. Successful candidates also meet the following requirements

* **Technical Expertise:**
* Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer with a focus on AI and machine learning applications.
* Strong proficiency in Frontend and Backend technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc.).
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization tools is highly desirable.
* Experience with AI & ML frameworks (LangGraph, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, etc.) and RESTful API design.
* **Collaborative Skills:**
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Strong communication skills to clearly articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* **Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience in developing enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is an added advantage.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
* 

**WHAT WE OFFER**


We are a value driven company with our values *We team up*, *Innovation Drives Us*, *No Douchebags* and *Going the Extra Mile* at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.


Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings

**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**


If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!


Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.


If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Backend Developer Intern (Remote)
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Backend Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in
 **API development, system integration, and backend architecture** 
 .
 



 This is a
 **remote, hands-on role** 
 where you will work closely with experienced developers to design, implement, and maintain backend services that support our AR platforms.
 



 While this is initially
 **unpaid** 
 , exceptional performance may lead to a
 **paid position** 
 after the internship.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Develop APIs** 
 : Build and maintain high-performance REST APIs using
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js** 
 .
* **Database Management** 
 : Work with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 and ORM tools (Sequelize) to design and optimize database schemas.

* **Testing & Quality Assurance** 
 : Write and run

 to ensure stability and performance.

 : Learn to work with
 **AWS cloud infrastructure** 
 and contribute to maintaining scalable, secure environments.
* **Troubleshooting & Maintenance** 
 : Help debug, patch, and optimize backend systems to improve reliability.
* **Code Reviews** 
 : Participate in peer reviews to maintain code quality and follow industry best practices.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js**
* Solid
 **JavaScript** 
 &
 **TypeScript** 
 skills
* Experience with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 (basic to intermediate)
* Familiarity with
 **AWS services** 
 (some training provided)
* Understanding of
 **Git** 
 (we use Bitbucket)
* Basic knowledge of
 **CI/CD pipelines**
* Awareness of
 **IT security fundamentals**
* (Bonus) Experience with
 **Sequelize ORM**



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Hands-on experience building backend systems for
 **real-world AR applications**
* Exposure to
 **AWS-based scalable architectures**
* Experience with
 **industrial-grade API design, testing, and security**
* Involvement in a
 **live product launch**



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Software Engineer
company_industry: Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing and Defense and Space Manufacturing
description:
Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.
   

  

**Title:** 
 Software Engineer
   

  

**Base location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**About The Product**
 Advanced Bot Protection defends mission-critical websites, mobile apps, and APIs from automated threats - bad bots - without affecting the flow of business-critical traffic. Bad bots are purpose-built to attack organizations’ websites and mobile apps through web scraping, account takeover, transaction fraud, denial of service, competitive data mining, unauthorized vulnerability scans, spam, click fraud, and web and mobile API abuse. A unique security concern, the bot problem is focused on abuse of business functionality rather than finding and exploiting vulnerabilities.
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are a team of programmers based in central Stockholm responsible for developing real-time bot detection software, data processing pipelines, and customer-facing tools. Our team works according to modern development practices and our main language is Rust. We also have frontends, and browser/mobile SDKs for Android and iOS. We operate a global infrastructure and deploy daily and we work closely with data scientists and cybersecurity threat researchers
   

  

**About You**
 We are now looking for a person who wants to help us in strengthening our defences against bad bots. You have an analytical and creative mindset and can approach problems from new angles. Most likely, you enjoy exploring new technologies and use them to your advantage, rather than being heavily specialized in a few areas.
   

  

**Expectations:**
* Minimum of 5 years experience developing and delivering distributed systems
* Solid experience and understanding of mobile devices and SDKs
* Strong interest in Rust
* Experience in Cloud environment, preferably AWS


**Advantage:**
* Experience with web browser technologies
* Experience with Terraform or similar
* Experience with cybersecurity


**Responsibilities Mobile Bot Protection:**
* Develop and maintain mobile SDK for Android and iOS
* Support customers with SDK integration and related issues
* Research and implement new capabilities for Mobile Bot Protection


 At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

title: Core Engineering - Software Engineer - Associate - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**What We Do**
 At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. Engineering, which is comprised of core and business-aligned teams, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.
   

  

**About Data Engineering**
 Data plays a critical role in every facet of the Goldman Sachs business. The Data Engineering group is at the core of that offering, focusing on providing the platform, processes, and governance, for enabling the availability of clean, organized, and impactful data to scale, streamline, and empower our core businesses. Within Data Engineering, we focus on offering a comprehensive data platform, Legend, which we have made available as an open-source product. Legend includes a full data modeling environment, as well as the execution of data access and controls, and a vast set of value-add products which allow our business users to operate more efficiently. Leveraging our own Legend offering, our engineers build efficient data solutions that source, curate, and distribute critical data to our businesses, including financial product, pricing, transaction, and client reference data. Our engineers collaborate closely with the business to design and curate business-specific data models, and to transform and distribute data for optimal storage and retrieval.
   

  

**Who We Look For**
 Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. As a Software Engineeron the Data Engineering team, you will be responsible for helping improve the Legend data platform, our curated data offerings, and how the business uses data. We tackle some of the most complex engineering problems across distributed software development, optimizing data access and delivery, enabling core access controls via well-defined security paradigms, building UIs to enable data visualization, using machine learning to curate data, or engaging with businesses to ensure their data needs are met, and we react quickly to new demands by rapidly evolving our data solutions.
   

  

**How You Will Fulfill Your Potential**
* Design & develop modern data management tools to curate and govern our most important data sets, models and processes, while identifying areas for process automation and further efficiencies.
* Engage with data consumers and producers to help them improve the quality of their data using the data governance tooling.
* Contribute to an open-source technology - https://github.com/finos/legend .


**Basic Qualifications**
* A Bachelor or Master degree in a computational field (Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or in a related quantitative discipline).
* 2-5 years of relevant work experience in a team-focused environment.
* Strong object-oriented design and programming skills and experience in OO languages (e.g., Java).
* Fluency with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
* Knowledge of relational and document databases.
* Knowledge of data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
* Comfort with Agile operating models (practical experience of Scrum / Kanban).
* Excellent communications skills and the ability to work with subject matter experts to extract critical business concepts.
* Independent thinker, willing to engage, challenge or learn.
* Ability to stay commercially focused and to always push for quantifiable commercial impact.
* Strong work ethic, a sense of ownership and urgency.
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Financial Services industry experience


**About Goldman Sachs**
 At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
   

  

 We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
   

  

 We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
   

  

 © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
   

  

 Goldman Sachs is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veterans status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Software Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens digitala bankupplevelse – tillsammans med andra som brinner för teknik och samhällsnytta?*
 Vi söker fler engagerade utvecklare som vill vara med och forma nästa generations digitala tjänster för sparande, investeringar och bank. Hos oss kombineras teknikintresse med samhällsengagemang – i team där gemenskap, samarbete och inkludering är en självklar del av vardagen. Vi tror på ett arbetsliv där det går att vara både ambitiös och mänsklig, där balans och meningsfullhet är lika viktiga som innovation.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi växer, och flera av våra utvecklingsteam söker nu nya kollegor. Som backendutvecklare hos oss arbetar du i ett agilt och självstyrande team med stort ansvar – från idé till produktion. Du får jobba med modern Java och mikrotjänstarkitektur i en miljö där vi hela tiden lär av varandra, testar nytt och strävar efter att göra skillnad för riktiga användare.
   

  

 Teknisk skicklighet är förstås viktigt – men hos oss är det lika avgörande att du tycker om att samarbeta, dela kunskap och bidra till en öppen och omtänksam teamkultur. Vi vill att du ska kunna växa både som utvecklare och människa.
   

  

**Så här jobbar vi**
 Vi är organiserade i ca 35 autonoma utvecklingsteam, uppdelade i åtta områden, där varje team har fullt ägarskap över sin produkt, sin roadmap och sina tekniska val. Vi arbetar datadrivet och iterativt, med fokus på att skapa verkligt värde för användarna och samtidigt bevara en hållbar utvecklingstakt.
   

  

 Parprogrammering och mobbprogrammering är en naturlig del av vår vardag, liksom gemensam design och kodgranskning. Lärande sker tillsammans, genom stöd och nyfikenhet – och vi firar våra framsteg, stora som små.
   

  

**Vi tror att du**
* Har erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla distribuerade system i Java
* Skriver välstrukturerad, testbar och skalbar kod
* Är nyfiken, kommunikativ och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra
* Har ett helhetstänk och vill bidra till både teamets och produktens utveckling
* Gillar en kultur där det är okej att fråga, dela, misslyckas och växa


 Har du dessutom erfarenhet av frontend (Angular), molnplattformar (som Google Cloud), datadrivet arbete eller brinner för tillgänglighet, AI eller fintech – så är det ett stort plus!
   

  

**Teknik vi jobbar med**
* Backend: Java 21, Spring Boot, mikrotjänster, Kafka, gRPC, REST, MongoDB, Event Sourcing
* Frontend: Angular 19
* Verktyg & infrastruktur: Git, Jenkins, Grafana, Splunk, Jira, Kanban, Gigaspaces


**En kultur för gemenskap och hållbarhet**
 Vi tror att de bästa resultaten uppstår i trygga team där alla får komma till tals. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid samarbete, öppenhet och arbetsglädje. Vi strävar efter jämställda team där alla känner sig trygga att vara sig själva och bidra med sin unika kompetens. Hos oss får du utrymme att utvecklas i din egen takt och kombinera arbetet med ett hållbart liv.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter balans i livet, mångfald av perspektiv och ett hållbart arbetsliv – både för individen och samhället i stort. Och vi bryr oss – om varandra, våra kunder och vår omvärld.
   

  

 Hos oss finns techforum, mentorprogram, kompetensutveckling, nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära inom tech – och kollegor som gärna fikar, kodar, lär och skrattar tillsammans.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Skicka din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök” nedan. Skicka din ansökan senast den
 **17** 
**/8** 
 .
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*
 Avanza är Sveriges ledande internetbank för sparande och placeringar. Vi drivs av att förändra branschen genom att utmana de stora bankerna och försäkringsbolagen på den svenska sparmarknaden. Vi vill vara tjänsten som förenklar och förbättrar spararnas ekonomi, oavsett om man älskar aktier eller bara vill ha ett bra sparande. Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. Därför står våra kunders bästa alltid i fokus, precis som det borde vara. Affärsidén är enkel – mer till dig, mindre till banken. En idé som gett oss Sveriges nöjdaste sparare 15 år i rad.

title: Advanced Javascript/C++ Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

* Contract: Permanent.
* Location: Stockholm (relocation support is provided).
* Work model: Hybrid (3 days a week onsite weekly).


 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 EAX In-game Experiences team is responsible for EA Connect, our social overlay facilitating cross-platform party, voip, quick messaging and game invites, used in most EA Sports titles. We are also responsible for the new Spotify integration recently released in FC 25.
   

  

 We are looking for someone to help us build experiences like this, using JavaScript and C++.
   

  

 You will be based in the Stockholm office in a hybrid work environment. You will report to an engineering lead in the team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will primarily be working with feature development in JavaScript, using TypeScript and React, running in an embedded JavaScript engine that connects to a C++ SDK in the game engine.
* You will improve our C++ SDK to support our JavaScript feature development.
* You will develop libraries and products used in multiple EA games.
* You will partner with game teams and ensure the code works on several platforms, always with an eye on performance.
* You will be part of the broader engineering group, and an important contributor to the EAX team based in Sweden.
* You will design systems and APIs and contribute to technical design and reviews


**Requirements**
* 7+ years of JavaScript programming experience
* Experience using TypeScript
* Experience using React or React Native
* Experience using Flexbox for layout
* 3+ years of C++ programming experience
* Understand how to adapt C++ code to be used on multiple platforms/compilers
* Experience developing and packaging C++ SDKs/libraries is a bonus


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Backend Developer - Customer Solutions
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Customer Solutions team, you'll build the intelligent systems that power Aira's growth across Europe. This role sits within our Customer Acquisition area, where you'll develop critical backend infrastructure including intelligent recommendation systems, dynamic pricing optimization, and market expansion capabilities. Working in an agile environment with cross-functional teams, you'll help scale our technical platform across diverse European markets while handling complex technical and regulatory requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build and maintain our customer solution matching platform—the backend systems that analyze customer inputs and property characteristics to recommend optimal clean energy solutions
* Develop scalable backend services that enable market teams with pricing capabilities and support company bets on new products through intelligent algorithms
* Create flexible, event-driven systems that can easily onboard new clean energy products and adapt to different markets, currencies, and regulatory requirements
* Design and implement APIs and microservices that support rapid geographic expansion while maintaining high performance and reliability


 We're transforming how clean energy solutions are discovered and delivered across Europe through smart backend systems. If you enjoy building scalable systems that directly drive business growth and enable market expansion in a mission-driven environment, this role offers exceptional technical challenges and impact.
   

  

 What you bring to the team
   

  

  

* Strong experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Solid understanding of databases and data modeling (SQL and NoSQL)
* Experience with automated testing (unit tests, integration tests)
* Experience building scalable, distributed systems
* Familiarity with cloud platforms and containerization
* Knowledge of modern development practices (CI/CD, code reviews, agile methodologies)


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with recommendation engines, pricing algorithms, or matching systems
* Database experience (DynamoDB, PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka, message queues)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
* Experience at fast-growing companies expanding into new markets


 Please note:
   

  

 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

 What is in it for you?
   

  

**Impact & Growth**
* Build systems that directly drive Aira's expansion across Europe and enable market teams
* Work on challenging technical problems including recommendation engines and pricing optimization
* Develop expertise in clean energy markets while contributing to meaningful climate action
* Build scalable infrastructure that supports rapid business growth and product diversification


**Team & Culture**
* Collaborate with talented, mission-driven teams across multiple disciplines and international markets
* Work in an agile, fast-paced environment with modern engineering practices
* Enjoy mentorship opportunities and career development in a growing engineering organization


**Work Environment**
* Hybrid work model with flexibility to balance office and remote work
* Brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm, conveniently located near Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations
* Competitive compensation and benefits package


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Software Engineer - Build & Deploy, Core Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 The Build & Deploy team specialises in making sure that 1000s of engineers have a non-eventful journey with their pipelines and deployments. We don’t just use tools; we build systems that give these tools meaning in a cohesive journey. We are in the midst of a transformation where we turn this team up to 11. Come and join us if you would like to see CI/CD at scale.
   

  

 What you'll be doing
   

  

* Design, develop, operate, and maintain cutting-edge solutions that allow for reuse and extensibility while solving primary problems at scale.
* Build and maintain backend solutions, working in the code to understand at a detailed level how the software works.
* Cultivate a deep understanding of how your systems impact our developers and other systems.
* Help grow other engineers technically by mentoring, pairing, and developing learning opportunities.
* Contribute to a culture of engineering excellence and strengthen the technical expertise of our engineering and product teams.
* Drive data-driven decisions to enhance the developer experience and implement proactive changes impacting the entire organization.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

 Must-haves:
   

  

* Proven experience as a Platform Engineer, Backend Engineer, or similar role.
* 6+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
* Strong understanding of software development processes and best practices.
* Proficiency in or willingness to learn at least one of the following programming languages: Go, Python3 (we primarily use Go in our team).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Proactive, data-driven mindset with the ability to drive changes that impact the entire organization.
* Good Working knowledge of databases such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or Cassandra.


 Nice to have:
   

  

* Worked with monorepos with build tools such as Bazel.
* Experience with CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions, Buildkite, Argo Workflows, Spinnaker, or similar.
* Proficiency in scripting and automation.
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Knowledge of package management, compliance & validations, and metrics.
* Experience in supporting large-scale development teams across multiple locations.
* Familiarity with on-call rotations and SOX compliance.
* Experience with asynchronous event streaming platforms or message queues (e.g., Kafka).


 Additional information
   

  

* You can choose the location from our tech hubs, Helsinki, Berlin, or Stockholm. You have the chance to decide the ways of working - a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the locations above.
* In addition to our country-specific benefits, our compensation package includes a monthly salary based on your expertise and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie. 🚀
* You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work. 🤩


 Next steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 If you want to check up on your application or have any further questions about the position, you can turn to Group Talent Acquisition Partner - Core group, Michal Szafraniec, at michal.szafraniec@wolt.com
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Join the Funnel Talent Pool — Product, Dev & Design
description:
At Funnel, we're building the future of data-driven marketing and that takes an exceptional team. While we may not have your
 *exact* 
 dream role open today, we’re always looking for brilliant minds to join us in the future.
   

  

 Whether You're a Designer, Developer Or Product Manager, We’d Love To Connect. By Joining Our Talent Pool, You’ll Be The First To Know When Opportunities That Match Your Background And Passion Open Up In Our
   

  

**Development team**
 Craft scalable, high-performance systems with a clean and modern tech stack - Typescript/Javascript, React, Node, Rust, Python and AWS.
   

  

 We love great architecture, elegant code, and a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
   

  

**Product team**
 Drive clarity in complexity. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and shape a product that solves real-world problems for marketers around the world.
   

  

****Design team****
 Create intuitive, elegant, and empowering experiences. From UX research to UI design, our designers shape the way people interact with data every day.
   

  

*Please note: all Product, Dev and Design teams are based in office in Stockholm, Sweden.*
******What We Value******
* Curiosity: You ask why. And then ask it again.
* Autonomy: You don’t wait for permission to solve a problem.
* Collaboration: You thrive on working closely with others.
* Impact: You want your work to matter- to your team, our users, and the business.


******Why Funnel?******
* 🌍 International team with a strong in office culture
* 👥 Friendly, smart and welcoming people
* 🛠️ Modern tech, continuous delivery, and true product ownership
* 💚 Inclusive, supportive culture that invests in people
* 🧘 Generous time off, team offsites, and wellness benefits


******Learn more about Funnel!******
* Who are we - a founder’s story
* Product development at Funnel - ways of working
* Why we built a data ingestion platform - unique problems we’re solving


 Interested?
   

  

 Let’s not wait for the perfect job ad to get to know each other. Apply to our Talent Pool with your CV or LinkedIn profile and tell us what position/s you would be interested in and what kind of work you enjoy doing.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

**Frostbite** 
 is EA's proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine uniquely adapts to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline.
   

  

 As a
 **Machine Learning Software Engineer** 
 in the Frostbite Quality AI team, you will design machine learning systems that improve engineering efficiency for Frostbite and our games. You will collaborate with other software engineers, data engineers and quality analysts. You will report to the Senior Manager of Engine Development of Quality Engineering. Our team promotes a culture of learning, innovation and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design machine learning-based solutions to real-world software development workflow problems.
* Build end-to-end systems, including model evaluation, deployment, data collection, debugging, performance improvement, and monitoring.
* Collaborate with data engineers to design real-time data processing that allows dynamic context and improved inference.
* Write clean, well-documented, well-tested code that integrates smoothly with existing codebases.
* Stay up-to-date on advancements in deep learning and generative AI through self-study and internal and external conferences.
* Be an active member of EA's growing AI/ML community, communicating to partners, sharing knowledge, and mentoring other team members to develop their skills.


**Qualifications**
* BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics, or equivalent experience.
* 2+ years of experience developing ML systems.
* Proficient in Python.
* Expertise in ML frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or MLFlow.
* Experience with large-scale machine learning, including big data and model deployment in distributed computing environments.
* Familiarity with the machine learning ecosystems of cloud providers (AWS, Azure).
* Proficiency in good software engineering practices (version control, unit testing, code reviews).


**Bonus if you have...**
* Familiarity with software quality processes, test automation, or game development processes.


 This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
⭐
 **Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer:**
 At Bannerflow, we build flexible and autonomous teams based on trust. We believe that when people are given the freedom to take ownership and work closely together, great things happen. Our engineering culture is shaped by openness, respect, and a shared drive to keep improving.
   

  

 We are passionate about solving real problems and making a meaningful impact, and we are always open to exploring new ideas. With us, you will be part of a growing tech company where ideas are valued, feedback is encouraged, and personal development is supported. We bring the energy of a fast-moving company together with the stability of a proven product and a strong customer base.
   

  

 You will join a team where motivation is high, knowledge is shared openly, and having fun is part of everyday life — whether it’s through hackathons, board game nights, or spontaneous team activities.
   

  

****🦋** 
 Are You + Bannerflow = True?**
**Role**
 We are now looking for an Engineering Manager who will inspire, lead and support several of our software engineering teams. In this role, you will have staff responsibility and play a central part in both the day-to-day and long-term success of your teams. While staying connected to technology, your focus will be on creating the conditions for your teams to thrive, deliver great software and develop both professionally and as a team. You will report directly to our CTO and work closely with other leaders across the organization. As an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 at Bannerflow, you will:
   

  

* Foster a healthy and collaborative engineering culture built on trust, openness and our company values
* Play a key role in attracting, developing and retaining top engineering talent
* Drive continuous improvement and help raise the bar for quality within and across teams
* Enable fast and focused execution without compromising on technical excellence
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices
* Work closely with other engineering managers and development teams to create great software


**So, what are we looking for?**
* 5 years of experience successfully leading teams and delivering results in roles such as product owner, product manager, scrum master, or technical lead
* Strong leadership and communication skills with a proven track record of fostering a collaborative engineering culture that puts people first
* Ability to inspire, coach, and mentor team members to help them grow and reach their full potential
* Passionate about agile software development and modern engineering practices, with developer experience considered a plus
* Fluent in English and Swedish and eligible to work full-time in Stockholm without restrictions
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, project management, or a related field


**Why join us? 🤔**
 As an Engineering Manager at Bannerflow, you will lead a passionate and skilled team, helping us build great products while growing together. You will foster collaboration, drive technical quality, and support agile ways of working in a fun and inclusive environment.
   

  

 At Bannerflow, we live our values of
 **passion** 
 ,
 **collaboration** 
 and
 **challenge** 
 in everything we do — from how we build software to how we celebrate success together. As a Software Engineer, you will play a key role in shaping the future of Ad Tech through innovative technology and product excellence. We offer a hybrid work setup, competitive compensation including ITP1 pension, health allowance, parental leave top-up and private health care insurance. We are also deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive team, welcoming applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and abilities. If you are ready to grow, learn and make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 📌 As we’re currently enjoying the Swedish summer, we’ll begin reviewing applications in August. Thanks for your patience!

title: Security Software Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 Canonical is looking for exceptional security-focused software engineers to be integrated across product teams. While they also contribute to the product as engineers, their primary focus is to challenge the entire team to think more deeply about security through state-of-the-art practices such as threat modeling, table-top exercises, architecture and design reviews, static analysis tools, and fuzzing, among others.
   

  

 These roles encompass all aspects of product security, including feature development, vulnerability response, proactive security, and open source community participation. Engineers in these roles collaborate closely with other Canonical teams, customers, and partners across the open source ecosystem.
   

  

 Each product engineering team at Canonical reserves one or two openings for security-oriented software engineers. We also develop a number of products driven entirely by security needs, such as our AppArmor kernel investments and the Ubuntu Security Guide (USG). As the publisher of Ubuntu, we also handle long-term security response for the entire operating system and open source ecosystem. Working with tens of thousands of upstreams means that we need to be fluent in every major programming language and design, build, and adopt sophisticated tools that enable us to work at scale and speed with confidence.
   

  

 Apply here if you are an exceptional security-focused software engineer, passionate about open source, and excited by Canonical's products and mission.
   

  

 This role requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through strong self-discipline and motivation. It also involves mandatory international travel at least twice a year, typically for one week.
   

  

 Location: Worldwide, this is a globally remote role
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

 Security roles might tackle any of the following:
   

  

* Define, implement, and document new security features
* Lead security-focused initiatives within a product engineering team
* Analyze, fix, and test vulnerabilities in open source software
* Contribute to Ubuntu and upstream open source projects to benefit the community
* Audit and analyze source code for vulnerabilities
* Integrate new tools into our security infrastructure, pipelines, and processes
* Achieve and retain various security certifications
* Extend and enhance Linux cryptographic components to meet country-specific compliance requirements, such as FIPS and Common Criteria (CC) certifications
* Work with external partners to develop Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmarks
* Design and develop hardening automation for Ubuntu
* Stay up to date with trends and developments in the security industry
* Develop, test, and maintain new software capabilities
* Provide guidance and support to other engineering teams on security best practices


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* A track record of going above and beyond expectations
* Thorough understanding of the common categories of security vulnerabilities and how to fix them
* Knowledge of modern software engineering techniques
* Familiarity with open source development tools and methodologies
* Skill in one or more of C, C++, Python, Go, Rust, Java, Ruby, PHP, or JavaScript/Typescript
* Experience as a security champion
* Experience driving security within a wider SSDLC process
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
